availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: I, Wm J, Waterman residing in the City of Detroit, County of Wayne, and state of Michigan, appointed by the Governor of Kentucky a Commissioner of deeds for said state, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of New York Kentucky.
Taken and subscribed this 27th day of June A. D. 1863 before me, at Detroit.

James V. Campbell
Associate Justice Supreme Court of Michigan

figure.ab:
WM J. WATERMAN

NOTARY

Michigan
Oath of W. J. Waterman
Comr of Deeds
